citation.article-title: Zhihengliuella halotolerans gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel member of the family Micrococcaceae
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Zhihengliuella [Zhi.heng.li.u.el′la. N.L. fem. dim. n. Zhihengliuella named after Zhi-Heng Liu (1940–), a Chinese microbiologist who devotes himself to the study of actinomycete taxonomy].
Cells are non-motile, non-spore-forming, short rods (0.6–1.0×1.5–2.0 μm).
The peptidoglycan type is A4α, l-lys–l-ala–l-Glu.
The predominant menaquinones are MK-9 and MK-10; MK-8 occurs in smaller amounts.
The major fatty acids are ai-C15 : 0 and i-C15 : 0.
The major polar lipids are phosphatidylglycerol, diphosphatidylglycerol and phosphatidylinositol.
The G+C content of genomic DNA is about 66 mol%.
16S rRNA gene sequence similarity reveals membership of the family Micrococcaceae.
The type species is Zhihengliuella halotolerans.
